Sentencas: Activation effect can be defined as the enhancement of the electrochemical performance or activity of the solid oxide fuel cell cathodes such as Sr-doped LaMnO3 (LSM) with the polarization/current passage treatment under fuel cell operation conditions.
Titulo: Activation, microstructure, and polarization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: In this paper, the activation effect of the cathodic polarization/current passage on the O-2 reduction reaction of the LSM-based cathodes is reviewed.
Titulo: Activation, microstructure, and polarization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: In addition to the activation effect, cathodic polarization/current passage also has a significant effect on the microstructure of the LSM electrodes and the morphology between the LSM electrode and Y2O3-ZrO2 electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Activation, microstructure, and polarization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: A mechanism involving the incorporation of SrO species into the LSM lattice and the formation of oxygen vacancies is proposed for the activation effect of the polarization.
Titulo: Activation, microstructure, and polarization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes
